title: 108_s851
content: The "Child Custody Protection Act" may be cited as the short title. Title 18, United States Code, is amended to include a new chapter on the transportation of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion. The "Child Custody Protection Act" introduces penalties for knowingly transporting a minor across state lines to obtain an abortion, in violation of parental involvement laws. The act aims to prevent minors from bypassing state regulations on abortion procedures. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits transporting a minor across state lines for an abortion without parental consent, except in cases where the minor's life is at risk. Minors and parents cannot be prosecuted for violating this law, and there is an affirmative defense if the defendant believed parental consent had been obtained. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits transporting a minor across state lines for an abortion without parental consent. Parents can seek civil action for harm caused by violations of this law. Definitions include requirements for parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision and the definition of a parent. The "Child Custody Protection Act" defines a minor as an individual subject to parental notification or consent laws regarding abortion decisions. It also includes definitions for parental involvement and the term "State." "117A. Transportation of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion."
